section.title: No Tasks Displayed in Dataset Selection Dialog
section.para: When a user attempts to access the Komet app while another instance is already active with the same dataset, they will see the message: “No task Running.”

figure.title: No Task Running
figure.para: Resolution - Please ensure that all instances of the Komet app (both web and desktop versions) are closed before attempting to open the application again.

section.title: When user tries to add new stamp version for concept, the data will revert to previous values after submitting
section.para: Resolution: User needs to change the view coordinates path to reflect the add new Stamp version changes to Concept.

listitem.para: Launch Komet and journal and access a concept.
If user wish to change the path for stamps from sandbox path to Master path.
Click on the parent view coordinate, and update the path to Master path

figure.title: Update to Master Path
figure.para: Now user can update the path from Sandbox path to Master path.

section.title: Users may face issues with GitHub sync/pull operations if prerequisites are not met
section.para: Resolution: Refer to the prerequisites document attached below before attempting GitHub synchronization or pull actions.

section.title: The Komet app may perform slowly or experience delays when handling large datasets
section.para: Resolution: Close unnecessary background browsers, applications (e.g., Zoom, Teams meetings/calls) to free up system memory to improve app performance.

section.title: Launching the Komet app without clearing preferences and Changeset folders may cause issues due to uncommitted values
section.para: Resolution: Before launching, navigate to the dataset folder in Solar, delete the preferences, and change the set folder to prevent using old values.

section.title: Issues may arise when creating or editing LIDR records without the appropriate dataset
section.para: Resolution: Ensure you are using the correct dataset (e.g., the September Connectathon dataset) that contains all necessary data for LIDR record operations.

section.title: Creating a pattern without specifying the concept in the correct fields can cause runtime exceptions
section.para: Resolution: When defining a pattern, always add the concept in the "Purpose/Meaning" fields, not Semantics or Patterns.

section.title: If a journal window is minimized and the user tries to reopen it from the landing page, it may not reappear
section.para: Resolution: Check the taskbar for the minimized journal window and restore it from there.

section.title: Users may need to verify which main build version of Komet they are using
section.para: Resolution: Search for "Komet" in Windows, right-click the application, select "Uninstall", and check the version listed under "Installed Apps" in the settings.

section.title: Type-ahead search may not always yield expected results
section.para: Resolution: For more accurate results, use the NextGen search icon, which provides improved search accuracy and if needed user can drag and drop the concept instead of typeahead.

section.title: Concept and pattern - For FQN and Other names, always select English language for Language field
section.para: Resolution : If user selects other languages apart from English, an exception might occur during creation process.

section.title: Refresh issue - The new concept created and reasoned does not show immediately in the Concept navigator
section.para: Resolution : The user should close the journal after running the reasoner, and open a new journal to see the new concept listed.
